intro: Andryala mollis, commonly known as the soft andryala, is a herbaceous plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, feathery leaves. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers that bloom in umbels, typical of the family. Andryala mollis is often found in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in temperate climates. Its botanical features make it a valuable subject for studies in plant ecology and phytochemistry.
